text.name: sys_description
text.text: The name Triforce refers to Nintendo's The Legend of Zelda series and also symbolizes the alliance of the three companies involved in the project Namco, Nintendo and Sega. The system is based on the architecture of the Nintendo GameCube, it nevertheless has some differences compared to the Gamecube. It is composed of several pcb boards whose number differs according to the revision. Sega has ensured that the GD-ROM player developed initially for the Dreamcast, then for the Naomi, is compatible.
